intro: Cyrtandra melinocalyx, commonly known as the Hawaiian bluebell, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It is a member of the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its striking blue-violet flowers. The plant typically grows in wet, shaded forest environments, often in the understory of native Hawaiian forests. Its leaves are ovate to elliptic, with a smooth margin, and it produces small, fleshy fruits that contain seeds. Cyrtandra melinocalyx is considered a rare and endangered species due to habitat loss and invasive species.
